issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
We are trying to register a Object (instance of MetricsObject) which has already been registered and unregistered. During this operation we got an exception during MetricsSourceBuilder.build()
{code}
org.apache.hadoop.metrics2.MetricsException: No valid @Metric annotation found.
	at org.apache.hadoop.metrics2.lib.MetricsSourceBuilder.build(MetricsSourceBuilder.java:83)
	at org.apache.hadoop.metrics2.impl.MetricsSystemImpl.register(MetricsSystemImpl.java:225)
	at org.apache.hadoop.metrics2.impl.TestMetricsSystemImpl.testUnregisterSource(TestMetricsSystemImpl.java:417)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
{code}
fields.summary: MetricsSourceBuilder doesn't set hasAtMetric when the Source object is reregistered

comments.body:
Attaching a patch which fixes this issue !
Surprisingly i do not have the right to assign the issue to my self and neither do i have the rights to add me as the contributor.
[~brahmareddy] or [~varun_saxena], if you guys have the right can you add me to this project?
Added your name to list of committers. Actually your old ID [~garlanaganarasimha@huawei.com] was present in the list.
Thanks [~varun_saxena], Hope you can further assist in reviewing the issue !

Not required, its easier for the clients to use a new Object rather than framework supporting reregistering of the same object with the MetricsSystem
